intro: Cordemoya acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata cordemoya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Cordemoya acuminata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
